verses.verse: For all<WH3605> this<WH2088> I considered<WH5414> in my heart<WH3820> even to declare<WH952> all<WH3605> this,<WH2088> that the righteous,<WH6662> and the wise,<WH2450> and their works,<WH5652> are in the hand<WH3027> of God:<WH430> no<WH369> man<WH120> knows<WH3045> either<WH1571> love<WH160> or hatred<WH8135> by all<WH3605> that is before<WH6440> them.

All<WH3605> things come alike<WH834> to all:<WH3605> there is one<WH259> event<WH4745> to the righteous,<WH6662> and to the wicked;<WH7563> to the good<WH2896> and to the clean,<WH2889> and to the unclean;<WH2931> to him that sacrifices,<WH2076> and to him that sacrifices<WH2076> not: as is the good,<WH2896> so is the sinner;<WH2398> and he that swears,<WH7650> as he that fears<WH3373> an oath.<WH7621>

This<WH2088> is an evil<WH7451> among all<WH3605> things that are done<WH6213> under<WH8478> the sun,<WH8121> that there is one<WH259> event<WH4745> to all:<WH3605> yes,<WH1571> also<WH1571> the heart<WH3820> of the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120> is full<WH4390> of evil,<WH7451> and madness<WH1947> is in their heart<WH3824> while they live,<WH2416> and after<WH310> that they go to the dead.<WH4191>
For to him that is joined<WH977> to all<WH3605> the living<WH2416> there is hope:<WH986> for a living<WH2416> dog<WH3611> is better<WH2896> than<WH4480> a dead<WH4191> lion.<WH738>

For the living<WH2416> know<WH3045> that they shall die:<WH4191> but the dead<WH4191> know<WH3045> not any<WH3972> thing, neither<WH1571> <WH369> have they any more<WH5750> a reward;<WH7939> for the memory<WH2143> of them is forgotten.<WH7911>

Also<WH1571> their love,<WH160> and their hatred,<WH8135> and their envy,<WH7068> is now<WH3528> perished;<WH6> neither<WH1571> <WH369> have they any more<WH5750> a portion<WH2506> for ever<WH5769> in any<WH3605> thing that is done<WH6213> under<WH8478> the sun.<WH8121>

Go<WH3212> your way, eat<WH398> your bread<WH3899> with joy,<WH8057> and drink<WH8354> your wine<WH3196> with a merry<WH2896> heart;<WH3820> for God<WH430> now<WH3528> accepts<WH7521> your works.<WH4639>
Let your garments<WH899> be always<WH3605> <WH6256> white;<WH3836> and let your head<WH7218> lack<WH2637> no<WH408> ointment.<WH8081>

Live<WH2416> joyfully<WH2416> with the wife<WH802> whom<WH834> you love<WH157> all<WH3605> the days<WH3117> of the life<WH2416> of your vanity,<WH1892> which<WH834> he has given<WH5414> you under<WH8478> the sun,<WH8121> all<WH3605> the days<WH3117> of your vanity:<WH1892> for that is your portion<WH2506> in this<WH2088> life,<WH2416> and in your labor<WH5999> which you take<WH6001> under<WH8478> the sun.<WH8121>

Whatever<WH3605> <WH834> your hand<WH3027> finds<WH4672> to do,<WH6213> do<WH6213> it with your might;<WH3581> for there is no<WH369> work,<WH4639> nor device,<WH2808> nor knowledge,<WH1847> nor wisdom,<WH2451> in the grave,<WH7585> where<WH834> <WH8033> you go.<WH1980>

I returned,<WH7725> and saw<WH7200> under<WH8478> the sun,<WH8121> that the race<WH4793> is not to the swift,<WH7031> nor<WH3808> the battle<WH4421> to the strong,<WH1368> neither<WH3808> yet<WH1571> bread<WH3899> to the wise,<WH2450> nor<WH3808> yet<WH1571> riches<WH6239> to men of understanding,<WH995> nor<WH3808> yet<WH1571> favor<WH2580> to men of skill;<WH3045> but time<WH6256> and chance<WH6294> happens<WH7136> to them all.<WH3605>

For man<WH120> also<WH1571> knows<WH3045> not his time:<WH6256> as the fishes<WH1709> that are taken<WH270> in an evil<WH7451> net,<WH4686> and as the birds<WH6833> that are caught<WH270> in the snare;<WH6341> so<WH1992> are the sons<WH1121> of men<WH120> snared<WH3369> in an evil<WH7451> time,<WH6256> when it falls<WH5307> suddenly<WH6597> on them.
This<WH2090> wisdom<WH2451> have I seen<WH7200> also<WH1571> under<WH8478> the sun,<WH8121> and it seemed great<WH1419> to me:

There was a little<WH6996> city,<WH5892> and few<WH4592> men<WH582> within it; and there came<WH935> a great<WH1419> king<WH4428> against<WH413> it, and besieged<WH5437> it, and built<WH1129> great<WH1419> bulwarks<WH4685> against<WH5921> it:

Now there was found<WH4672> in it a poor<WH4542> wise<WH2450> man,<WH376> and he by his wisdom<WH2451> delivered<WH4422> the city;<WH5892> yet no<WH3808> man<WH120> remembered<WH2142> that same<WH1931> poor<WH4542> man.<WH376>
Then said<WH559> I, Wisdom<WH2451> is better<WH2896> than strength:<WH1369> nevertheless the poor<WH4542> man's wisdom<WH2451> is despised,<WH959> and his words<WH1697> are not heard.<WH8085>
The words<WH1697> of wise<WH2450> men are heard<WH8085> in quiet<WH5183> more than the cry<WH2201> of him that rules<WH4910> among fools.<WH3684>
Wisdom<WH2451> is better<WH2896> than weapons<WH3627> of war:<WH7128> but one<WH259> sinner<WH2398> destroys<WH6> much<WH7235> good.<WH2896>
